data.question: What is the publication year of the article discussing the vapochromic complex {Tl[Au(C6Cl5)2]}n?
Which institution is associated with the corresponding author of the study on {Tl[Au(C6Cl5)2]}n?
What is the emission wavelength of complex 1 at room temperature when excited at 495 nm?
How does the emission wavelength of complex 1 change when exposed to tetrahydrofuran (THF) vapor at room temperature?
What is the effect of temperature on the luminescence of complex 1, based on its behavior at room temperature and 77 K?
data.answer: The emission is shifted to 547 nm at 77 K, indicating thermochromism.

data.question: Which organic vapors were used to demonstrate the vapochromic behavior of complex 1?
data.answer: Acetone, acetonitrile, triethylamine, acetylacetone, tetrahydrothiophene, 2-fluoropyridine, tetrahydrofuran, and pyridine

data.question: What is the relationship between the emission energy of complex 1 and particle size at 77 K?
data.answer: The emission energy shifts with particle size due to the quantum size effect.

data.question: Why does complex 1 exhibit different emission wavelengths when exposed to various organic vapors?
data.answer: The shifts are presumably associated with a weak interaction of the Tl(I) centers with the VOCs.

data.question: How does the structure of complex 1 contribute to its vapochromic behavior?
data.answer: The structure has channels and holes that can accommodate various solvents, allowing reversible interactions with VOCs.

data.question: What is the significance of the Au-Tl distances in the structure of complex 1?
data.answer: The Au-Tl distances are shorter than the sum of Au(I) and Tl(I) ionic radii, indicating strong interactions that contribute to the stability and properties of the complex.

data.question: How does the presence of long Tl···Cl and Au···Cl contacts in the structure of complex 1 affect its stability?
data.answer: These contacts contribute to the stability of the system by providing additional interactions.

data.question: What role does the thermal contraction play in the thermochromism observed in complex 1?
data.answer: Thermal contraction shortens the Au-Tl distance at low temperatures, increasing the overlap between the Au(I) and Tl(I) orbitals, which reduces the HOMO-LUMO gap and lowers the energy of the emission band.

data.question: True or False: The emission spectrum of complex 1 is dependent on the excitation wavelength.
True or False: Complex 1 is luminescent when dissolved in THF.
True or False: The color changes observed in complex 1 upon exposure to VOCs are irreversible.
True or False: The scanning electron microscope images suggest that complex 1 is an insulator.
True or False: The decay of the emission of complex 1 at 298 K suggests a phosphorescence mechanism.
True or False: The absorption spectra of complex 1 in the solid state and in THF solution are identical.
True or False: The luminescence observed in complex 1 originates from interactions between the Au and Tl centers.
